comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune., May 25, 1913, Page 2, Image 44 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1913-05-25/ed-... mentions a Mrs. George Austin Morrison. The sun., December 01, 1916, Page 5 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030431/1916-12-01/ed-... reports his death but does not identify her maiden name.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.electricscotland.com/history/descendants/chap112.htm identifies the wife of George Austin Morrison as Magdalen Sophrona Worden, daughter of the late Linas Dean and Mary Ann (Kraft) Worden. They married in April 1912. Magdalen Sophrona Worden was born Oct. 3, 1884 (according to www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/new-york-genealogical-and-... ) which is compatible with the age of this woman. I haven't found any confirming pictures yet. If it is her, she was a pinist and composer.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT, April 22, 1906 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0E1EFB3A5A1273... has a picture of Miss Worden when she became organist at the Baptist Church of the Epiphany. It could certainly be the same woman.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  Looks like the same person to me!  Thanks for your sleuthing.  We'll include Worden's full name in the description next time we update.
